page.title: 16CATTLE FARMING
page.content:
Local cattle husbandry is largely applied to the production of beef, with the most popular breeds coming from Fresian X Hereford, Fresian X Charolais or Fresian X Aberdeen Angus. Recently however we have seen an increase in the number of pure bred Charolais and the introduction of the Limousan.
The small number of dairy units within the area seem to favour the Fresian strains. Milking is carried out twice daily with the milk being farm stored in refrigerated stainless steel bulk tanks, ready for daily collection by Milk Marketing Board road tankers and subsequent delivery to either the dairy for bottling, or to the creamery for conversion into butter and cheese.
